briefdescription.para: IPsec direction types For PHY ASIC Egress is system to line direction and ingress is the opposite.
IPsec cipher suite types.

detaileddescription.para: SA byte count below lower of 2 watermarks
SA byte count below higher of 2 watermarks
SA byte count above higher of 2 watermarks

briefdescription.para: IPsec SA sequence number status type.
Start of IPsec attributes.
Security Engine supports matching source IP address for tunnel termination.

detaileddescription.para: If false, source IP address cannot be checked before decryption.

briefdescription.para: SAI_SWITCH_SWITCHING_MODE_CUT_THROUGH supported.
SAI_SWITCH_SWITCHING_MODE_STORE_AND_FORWARD supported.
SAI_STATS_MODE_READ supported.
SAI_STATS_MODE_READ_CLEAR supported.
Indicates if 32-bit Sequence Number (SN) is supported.
Indicates if 64-bit Extended Sequence Number (ESN) is supported.
List of supported cipher suites.
IPsec MTU capability on system side (not including IPsec overhead).
Warm boot is supported for all saiipsec objects.
If false, disables creation of saiipsec objects during warm-boot.
If true, SA Index is assigned by NOS. If false, SA Index is assigned by IPsec SAI driver.
TPID value used to identify C-tag.
TPID value used to identify S-tag.
Maximum number of VLAN tags to parse.
High watermark for byte count.

detaileddescription.para: The sai_ipsec_sa_status changes when a new packet is processed and the per SA octet count crosses this watermark. This watermark is used even if only 1 watermark is needed.

briefdescription.para: Low watermark for byte count.

detaileddescription.para: The sai_ipsec_sa_status changes when a new packet is processed and the per SA octet count crosses this watermark. This watermark is used only if 2 watermarks are needed.

briefdescription.para: Global setting of read-clear or read-only for statistics read. The mode parameter for get_ipsec_<foo>_stats_ext should match this.
Available IPsec Security Associations.
IPsec SA list.
End of IPsec attributes.
Custom range base value.
End of custom range base.
Attribute Id for sai_ipsec.
Start of IPsec Port attributes.
Associated port id.
Enable vlan tag parsing for C-tag TPID.
Enable vlan tag parsing for S-tag TPID.
Port native Vlan Id used for Security Engine SA termination.
Enable VRF identification from ingress parsed packet Vlan.

detaileddescription.para: False means only port native Vlan can be used for tunnel termination VRF. True means packet Vlan tag is also used.

briefdescription.para: Switching mode for port. If configured as cut-through, the IPG for Tx MAC in the switch ASIC has to be increased to accommodate the IPsec packet size expansion.
End of IPsec Port attributes.
Custom range base value.
End of custom range base.
Attribute Id for sai_ipsec_port.
Packets dropped after receive MAC and before IPsec SA processing. This could be due to malformed header, buffer overrun, etc.
Packets mapped to an SA for IPsec processing.
Non-IPsec packets that pass through this port.
Packets dropped after receive MAC and before IPsec SA processing. This could be due to malformed header, buffer overrun, etc.
Packets mapped to an SA for IPsec processing.
Non-IPsec packets that pass through this port.
IPsec flow counter IDs in sai_get_ipsec_sa_stats() call.
Start of IPsec Security Association attributes.
IPsec direction.
IPsec object id.
SA byte count status.
Externally assigned SA Index value for this Security Association. Used only when SAI_IPSEC_ATTR_EXTERNAL_SA_INDEX_ENABLE == true.
SA Index value for this Security Association.
List of IPsec ports for this SA.
SPI value for this Security Association, carried in ESP header.
Enable 64-bit ESN (vs 32-bit SN) for this Security Association.
Cipher suite for this SA.
IPsec Traffic Encryption Key used for encryption/decryption. Network Byte order. AES128 uses only Bytes 16..31.
IPsec Salt portion of IV Network Byte order.
IPsec Authentication Key Network Byte order.
Replay protection enable for this Security Association.
Replay protection window for this Security Association.
SA local IP address for tunnel termination.
Match Vlan Id for tunnel termination.
Vlan Id for tunnel termination.
Match remote IP address for tunnel termination.
Remote IP address for tunnel termination.
IPsec egress sequence number (SN). One less than the next SN.
Minimum value of ingress IPsec sequence number (SN). Can be Updated by value from IPsec peer for gross level delay prevention.
End of IPsec Security Association attributes.
Custom range base value.
End of custom range base.
Attribute Id for sai_ipsec_sa.
Total octets in all Ethernet frames processed by this SA.
Count of Ethernet frames processed by this SA. This should normally be the sum of all the good and error packets for this SA.
Count of validated error-free received (ingress) packets for this SA. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.
Count of packets with bad header for this SA. This could be due the packet header being different from the format expected for this SA. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.
Count of replayed packets. This also includes late packets if the hardware does not provide a separate counter for late packets. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.
Count of packets outside the replay window. Always 0 if the hardware does not provide a separate counter for late packets. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.

Count of packets with bad trailer. This could be due to insufficient or invalid padding, etc. For cut-through switching, this drop would normally be implemented as CRC corruption. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.
Count of packets with authentication and integrity failure For cut-through switching, this drop would normally be implemented as CRC corruption. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.

Count of dummy packets dropped by IPsec logic. These are packets with 59 as the next header field value in IPsec trailer. For cut-through switching, this drop would normally be implemented as CRC corruption. Valid only for ingress, always returns 0 for egress.
Count of other packets dropped by IPsec logic. This could be due to not programmed or incorrectly programmed SA, MTU violation, etc.
IPsec flow counter IDs in sai_get_ipsec_sa_stats() call.
